div.a: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre:
1259 Cilicia, before 1914 (252) Burial: c. 380 B.C. (Newell) Contents: 89+ AR Syracuse: 1 tetradr. ANS 1944.100.55773
Athens: 35 tetradr. Eastern imit. of Athens: 3 tetradr.; 1 frag. ANS 1944.100.24216 ANS 1944.100.24215 ANS 1944.100.24203 ANS 1944.100.24214 ANS 1944.100.24191 ANS 1944.100.24202 ANS 1944.100.24234 ANS 1944.100.24235 ANS 1944.100.24210 ANS 1944.100.24199 ANS 1944.100.24186 ANS 0000.999.10179 ANS 1974.26.239 ANS 1944.100.24205 ANS 1944.100.24217 ANS 1944.100.24187 ANS 1944.100.24204 ANS 1968.34.30 ANS 1944.100.24397 ANS 1944.100.24218 ANS 1968.34.31 ANS 1944.100.83592 ANS 1944.100.24494
Sinope: 5 sigloi; 1 frag. ANS 1944.100.41698 ANS 1944.100.41779 ANS 1944.100.41712 ANS 1944.100.41697 ANS 1944.100.41772 ANS 1944.100.41696
Miletus: 4 ob.
Samos: 1 tetradr. ANS 1944.100.47292
Tlos: 1 st. ANS 11944.100.50751
Aspendus: 4 double-sigloi ANS 1944.100.50777 ANS 1944.100.50773 ANS 1944.100.50774 ANS 1944.100.50776
Side: 1 double-siglos ANS 1944.100.50899
Celenderis: 2 double-sigloi ANS 1944.100.53206
Issus: 2 double-sigloi ANS 1944.100.54079 ANS 1944.100.54080 ANS 1944.100.54082
Mallus: 6 double-sigloi ANS 1944.100.54093 ANS 1944.100.54103 ANS 1944.100.54106 ANS 1944.100.54094 ANS 1944.100.54104 ANS 1944.100.54105
Soli: 14 double-sigloi ANS 1944.100.54267 ANS 1944.100.54275 ANS 1944.100.54276 ANS 1967.152.496 ANS 1944.100.54274 ANS 1944.100.54270 ANS 1944.100.54269 ANS 1944.100.54268 ANS 1944.100.54260 ANS 1944.100.54266
Citium: 1 double-sigloi; 1 third ANS 1944.100.57986 ANS 1944.100.57983
Salamis: 2 double-sigloi ANS 1944.100.58065 ANS 1944.100.58066
Aradus: 3 double-sigloi
Tyre: 2 st. ANS 1944.100.72670 ANS 1944.100.72668
Unc. mint: 1 st. Disposition: London, a part; New York 60, as above except Athens 15, Sinope 3 (2 not in NC 1914)+ 1 frag., Miletus 1, Soli 10, Aradus 2, Unc. mint 0. New York has in addition 31 of the disputed pieces (Byzantium 4, sigloi 27) and another 3 oriental imit. of Athens (purchased by Newell from a dealer in New York in 1923) which have the deep chisel cuts characteristic of this Cilician find and may be from the hd. † Newell, NC 1914, pp. 1-33, illus. Schlumberger, L'argent grec, p. 7, no. 5 Le Rider, Deux trésors, pp. 46 f. Barron, Samos, p. 116, no. 14 According to Le Rider and Barron 5 dr. of Byzantium, 1 of Calchedon, and 48 Persian sigloi listed by Newell do not belong to the hd. See, however, Schönert-Geiss, Münzprägung Byzan- tion, Register s.v. Fund von Kilikien, who would retain the coins of Byzan- tium and Calchedon
